page.title: 07PRESENT USE OF HOUGHTON HALL
page.content: Today Houghton Hall and grounds are open to the public on THURSDAYS & SUNDAYS.The present admission charge of Â£1.5O for adults includes entry to the HOUSE,GROUNDS,PICNIC AREA,STABLES AND COLLECTION of MODEL SOLDIERS & MILITARIA.There are facilities for disabled, including a lift in the house.The stables now house heavy horses and shetland ponies.Harness which belonged to the first MARQUESS of CHOLMONDELEY together with the other equipment and coaches are on display.The stable block, at a little distance from the house, is brick built faced with carr stone and contains some unusual vaulting. Originally the first floor housed the grooms and their families but now there are living quarters for people connected with the estate.In the parkland a herd of white deer roam.
